(if: $chaptertitle1 is true)[<span id="titles">I. On the Ethics of dark wizard-Slaying...</span>(set: $enterCitadelgoal to 2)(set: $SMUGgoal to 1)(set: $Meekagoal to 1)(set: $darkwizardseegoal to 1)(set: $chaptertitle1 to false) <span id="dialogue">You have new quest goals: Talk to SMUG, Talk to Meeka, Take a closer look at that dark wizard... (Optional)</span>](else:)[<span id="titles">THE dark wizard'S Citadel</span>] (if: $darkwizardexplored is false)[The [[colossal dark wizard->slumbering dark wizard]] sleeps curled up at the end of his bed, clutching hold of one of the bed post tightly, his belly heaving with every breath. You look down on him from a steep balcony that overlooks the main bedroom.](else-if: $darkwizardexplored is true)[The colossal dark wizard sleeps curled up at the end of his bed, clutching hold of one of the bed post tightly, his belly heaving with every breath. You look down on him from a steep balcony that overlooks the main bedroom.] (if: $darkwizardready < 1)[[[SMUG->SMUGCitadel]] clutches his sword, sizing up the dark wizard. <span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "Just one good clean swing is all it'll take, I reckon?"</span> [[Meeka->MeekaCitadel]] gazes at the all powerful slumbering wizard. <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "I don't think a swing of the sword is going to do the job."</span>](else:)[[[SMUG->SMUGCitadel]] eyes the dark wizard, clutching his sword. [[Meeka->MeekaCitadel]] cocks her head and looks at the slumbering wizard with curiousity.](if: $roastedadventurer is true)[ In the far corner of the Citadel, [[something metal]] glints in the dark...](else:)[(if: $talkingsword is false)[ In the far corner of the Citadel, you see the remains of the [[fallen adventurer.->something metal]]](else-if: $talkingsword is true)[ In the far corner of the Citadel, you see the remains of the fallen adventurer.]] (if: $darkwizardready is 2)[You're as ready as you'll ever be. It's time to [[deal with the dark wizard...->FamousLastWords]]]It starts as just a tickle in the back of your throat. You scrunch up your face and kid yourself that you can keep it under wraps. But it's persistent. Inevitable, even. It keeps nagging at you. And soon, it's roaring out of you and ripping through the Citadel, echoing and shaking cobwebs from the stalactices. The mother of all sneezes. SMUG spins around and stares at you. <span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "*You fuckin' dipshit.*"</span> The dark wizard's eyes snap open. It rears back. If you don't warn SMUG, he's a goner. But if you do, the dark wizard might turn its attention on *you*. [["SMUG! Watch out!"]] [[Keep quiet.]](set: $darkwizardwounded to true)SMUG brings the sword down on the dark wizard's neck with a wet (text-style: "rumble")[thwack]. The dark wizard's eyes snap open and he keens in pain. Hardly a flesh wound. It rears back and SMUG - still clutching onto the sword that's still embedded in the dark wizard's neck - is lifted clear off the ground. The dark wizard thrashes wildly, spraying bursts of sparks from its fingers between raspy shrieks. SMUG loses his grip on his sword and goes flying. He slams against the wall of the Citadel and lies crumpled there. <span id="dialogue">SMUG narrowly survived... but has been knocked out cold!</span> [[Draw your sword.->FightOrNegotiate]] [[Ready your shield.->FightOrNegotiate]]<span id="titles">THE GANGRENOUS STUMP</span> Behind the bar, a [[grizzled old orc]] (either: "scrubs a filthy mug with an even filthier rag", "pours a beer stein so full of ale it almost overflows", "whistles a jaunty tune as he mops", "takes inventory of the pickled eggs in a huge cracked jar"). (if: $ruffians is 0)[In the corner, some [[rowdy ruffians]] play games with a dagger. (either: "A muscled", "A wiry", "A heavily scarred", "A spritely", "A sleepy-looking", "A scruffy") (either: "man", "woman", "elf", "orc", "dwarf", "goblin") (either: "accidently stabs a finger and cries out in pain while the others howl with laughter.", "puts on an impressive show, waving the dagger through the air.", "belches loudly, prompting applause from the other ruffians.")](else:)[In the corner, the rowdy ruffians lay sprawled on the barroom floor, unconscious.] (if: $monkquest is 0 or 1)[A [[monk]] sits in the corner, (either: "fingering prayer beads", "sipping a steaming cup of tea", "reading a thick tome", "knitting something out of thick spider's wool").](else-if: $monkquest is 2)[Brother Thullo, forsaking his vows, (either: "finishes chugging a stein of ale and screams angrily for another", "knocks back three flaming shots in quick succession", "gorges himself on brined eggs", "kisses a barmaid, then a ruffian").](else-if: $monkquest is 3)[Brother Thullo sits in the corner, (either: "fingering prayer beads", "sipping a steaming cup of tea", "reading a thick tome", "knitting something out of spider's wool").] Beside you, Meeka (either: "stares right through you with her silvery eyes", "regards the mayhem of the barroom with disdain", "quietly chants a spell to herself to protect her from the madness of the barroom").(if: $SMUGisalive is true)[ SMUG (either:"downs another pitcher of ale", "regales some strangers with exaggerated stories of his adventures", "plays an off-kilter tune on the janky piano near the bar").] [[Exit The Gangrenous Stump.->ExitStump]]The bartender (either: "offers you a sweet smile.", "nods cordially to you.", "cocks his gnarled ear towards you and asks what it'll be tonight.") Never have to buy my own drinks again so long as I live."</span> [[Back away slowly.->Enter the dark wizard's Citadel.]](set: $SMUGgoal to 2)(if: $SMUGtalkedto is false)[<span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u>: "Look, I'm thinkin' you two oughta just stand back and let me handle this. Earth to Meeka."->Meekadark wizardTalk]] [[Wave your hand in front of her face.]]]You stand at the edge of the balcony. The ground beneath your feet is shale that threatens to give way under your weight. You hold up your torch. The dark wizard's cloak shimmers in its light. Old scars criss-cross his face -- marks of hundreds of past adventurers who have tried and failed to slay the wizard. The dark wizard stirs, loosing a hot snort from its huge nostrils as it lets out a sigh and clutches the beloved bedpost even tighter One wrong move could wake it... [[Creep a little bit closer...]] [[Retreat...->Enter the dark wizard's Citadel.]](align:"=><==")[<span id="titles">🍺SMUGGLER'S PASS🐉</span> *A screwball noir fantasy about what happens <u>after</u> you slay the dark wizard.* [[Play.->storyinit]] [[Load a previous save.]] [[Instructions.]] [[Content warnings.]] [[Credits.]]]When you and your companions are approached by a man in a tavern who offers you more gold than you could spend in one lifetime to storm the Citadel and take out the dark wizard, you're torn. The money would buy you out from under the boot of the King. You'd never want for anything again. But do you schmucks really stand a chance against the dark wizard? Your instructions are simple. Travel to the Citadel. Chop off the dark wizard's head. Bring it to Gmemia, the village at the base of the mountains. Meet your patron in the tavern to collect your spoils. If only you hadn't been too drunk to remember exactly WHICH tavern you were supposed to meet him in. Now, you'll have to journey from tavern to tavern looking for him. An inn full of yearning hearts and true believers. A burlesque house full of cutthroats and intrigue. A dive bar where you're likely to walk out with fewer digits than you walked in with. As you uncover the strange secrets of Gmemia, you begin to realize you've been lied to, set up. Can you unravel the mystery and get out from under before last call? You play SMUGGLER'S PASS by *reading* and *clicking links*. Some links take you to new locations. Some links reveal more information. Other links are choices that let you say something or take an action. [[Learn about stats.]] [[Learn about quests.]] [[Learn about gold.]] [[Learn about saving your game.]] [[Return to the start menu.->SMUGGLER'S PASS]]Writing and interactivity by Smug Made with love for all my Zork loving hommies [[Back to start page->SMUGGLER'S PASS]] (set: $darkwizardready to $darkwizardready + 1)(set: $Meekatalkedto to true)(set: $Meekagoal to 2)<span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "Oh! Hello! Sorry. I was a little... distracted."</span> She looks at you... but it seems to pain her to tear her eyes away from the dark wizard, and soon she's resumed staring at him. <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "But can you blame me? Don't you think there has to be another way besides cutting his head off? Wouldn't the towns people want more justice to be served with punishment at their hands?..."</span> [[Stare at the dark wizard, truly seeing the point of full justice.]] [["I guess it is poetically beautiful...to force him to watch the world move on without his control"]] [["Justice will happen once he's dead."]]<span id="dialogue">+ 1 TANK</span>(set: $Meeka to $Meeka - 1)(set: $tank to $tank + 1) <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> *(shaking her head in disgust)* "I guess all this time with SMUG is starting to rub off on you. I can understand wanting to stop the dark wizard so the village doesn't have to live in fear... but to take joy in killing such someone?"</span> <span id="dialogue">Meeka disliked that.</span> (display: "SMUG approaches")(goto: "Meekadark wizardTalk")<span id="dialogue">+ 1 MAGE</span>(set: $mage to $mage + 1)(set: $Meekatalkedto to true)(set: $Meeka to $Meeka + 1) Even for an adventurer, dark wizards are no common sight, and before this, you've only seen sketches in books. You take a good look at the dark wizard, its hard, old wrinkled body, clutching bedpost as if it has mother issues as its vast body struggles to breath. Realizing that the myths of how powerful these wizards are might be greatly overly stated. <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "See? Is this really Justice? Doesn't it seem like... sort of a waste... to kill something that deserves far worse?"</span> <span id="dialogue">Meeka liked that!</span> (display: "SMUG approaches")<span id="dialogue">+ 1 ROGUE</span>(set: $rogue to $rogue + 1) <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> *(chuckling)* "I always appreciate you making the effort to see the world the way I do. Not many do, you know."</span> <span id="dialogue">Meeka liked that.</span> <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "See? Is this really Justice? Doesn't it seem like... sort of a waste... to kill something that deserves far worse?"</span> (display: "SMUG approaches")You slide down the steep balcony, drawing closer to the dark wizard. A basket of green eggs are nested beneath the dark wizard's bed. The eggs are crushed, destroyed... but the dark wizard still keeps close to them, unwilling to abandon his ill gotten gains. <span id="dialogue">You found a vital clue.</span>(set: $darkwizardseegoal to 2)(set: $darkwizardexplored to true) The dark wizard suddenly stirs. His grip around the bedpost loosens. His eyes are still shut tight, but he stretches its arms, reaching at the darkness... (if: $tank >= 2)[ [[Deftly hide in a nearby crevice. (⭐ 2 TANK)]]](else:)[<span id="locked"><s>Deftly hide in a nearby crevice.</s> ( 🔒 2 TANK)</span>] [[Frantically scramble backwards.]] [[Don't... move... an inch...]](link: "Stats▼")[(replace: ?statworkarea)[(display: "Stat Collapse Button and Dropdown")]](link: "Stats▲")[(replace: ?statworkarea)[(display: "Stat Button")]] (if: $stattutorial is true)[ Don't worry. Careful not to make the wrong choices, or you might lose them!*</span>(set: $sword to true)(set: $shield to true)(set: $torch to true) [[Set out on your journey.]]You take the eastern pass. In the distance, the high king's great machines dot the landscape, lumbering and dragging themselves along. Your journey takes you farther and farther away from them, until you can barely see the smoke over the horizon. <span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "These are good honest folk in this village, independents. If we don't do this, they might not make it. Or worse, they might have to turn to the high king for help."</span> <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "I simply don't understand why the dark wizard has to *die*."</span> <span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "One more village in the grip of the king. That what you want to see?"</span> You reach the mountains and begin the ascent towards [[Gmemia's Peak.->Climb]]By the light of your torch, you see that the glinting metal is chainmail armor on a charred, rotting corpse. Looks like another adventurer tried to take on the dark wizard and didn't fare so well... [[Loot the corpse.]] [[Whisper a quiet prayer.]] [[Try to get a better idea of how he died.]]<span id="dialogue">+ 1 ROGUE</span>(set: $rogue to $rogue + 1) You draw closer, flop over the corpse, root around in its pockets. Melted coins tumble out and roll away along the craggy floor of the Citadel. You find only a few meagre coins in good enough shape that a merchant might take them. <span id="dialogue">+ 5 GOLD</span>(set: $gold to $gold + 5) There's an envelope poking out of the dead shmuck's breastpocket. (display: "swordwhispers")<span id="dialogue">+ 1 MAGE</span>(set: $mage to $mage + 1) You nod your head, close your eyes, and offer a silent wish that whichever gods this adventurer worshipped might usher his soul safely into the next life. There's an envelope poking out of the dead shmuck's breastpocket. (display: "swordwhispers")<span id="dialogue"> + 1 TANK </span>(set: $tank to $tank + 1) You crouch and examine the entire sad scene. Footprints lead up to the corpse -- frantic, messy footprints that match the dead adventurer's heavy boots. In the torch's flickering light, huge splinters come into focus on the wall of the Citadel above -- the dark wizard's must have bashed in the adventurer with something wooden before set him a blaze with some type of spell. This poor schmuck must have tried to flee the dark wizard, perhaps opting to hide in this dark crevice. Instead, he found himself cornered. It looks like the Wizard took his time savoring each brutal hit before finally setting fire to this poor soul... There's an envelope poking out of the dead shmuck's breastpocket. (display: "swordwhispers")(set: $roastedadventurer to false)[[Examine the envelope.]] [[Step away.->Enter the dark wizard's Citadel.]]You scramble back up the balcony. The ground shifts and crumbles beneath your feet. It's almost impossible to get your footing. In your mad scurry, you lose your grip on your torch. It clatters to the ground and bounces to the bottom of the room below, its light extinguished. <span id="dialogue">You lost your torch!</span>(set: $torch to false) You glance back at the dark wizard. It's gone back to sleep. *Classic.* [[Clamber back up the balcony.->Enter the dark wizard's Citadel.]]You freeze up. The dark wizard's fitful tossing and turning knocks loose some rocks from the roof of the Citadel. You throw up your arms seconds too late and feel stinging pain. Warm blood rolls down from a gash above your eye. <span id="dialogue">You lost 2 health.</span>(set: $health to $health - 2) When you've wiped away the blood and blinked away the pain, you glance back at the dark wizard. It's gone back to sleep. *Classic.* [[Clamber back up the balcony.->Enter the dark wizard's Citadel.]]You spy the narrow space under the bed where you seen the crushed eggs, just close enough for you to deftly roll into. You flatten your body, barely allowing yourself a breath. Hoping you don't share the same fate as the once green and thriving eggs. The dark wizard opens a single eye, glancing around. It misses you entirely, shuts its eyes, and goes back to sleep. <span id="dialogue">Thanks to quick strategic thinking, you survived a close call with the dark wizard without a scratch.</span> You sigh relief and slide out from under his bed.. [[Clamber back up the balcony.->Enter the dark wizard's Citadel.]]SMUG and Meeka listen as you describe the cracked eggs you saw under the dark wizard's bed. <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "So why does the dark wizard *cheerish* these damn old eggs so much?"</span> (set: $telldarkwizard to true) <span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "It's good to know. Necrotic magic was forbidden. One of the worst imaginable sins. You lift your hands and mutter one of the [[forbidden incantations.]]The dark wizard is distracted, enraged. You get in close, wait til it opens its eye, and thrust the sword. Dark blood spills into the dark wizard's eyes, as he brays louder, he recoils his arms to his face and drops his bedpost leaving his belly open for an attack. The barkeep is shooing out the last patrons at [[the Red Roof Inn]]...<span id="titles">LAST CALL AT THE RED ROOF INN...</span> (if: $dogquest is 3)[DOGE sleeps lazily on the floor, surrounded by her puppies.](else:)[The dog sleeps lazily on the floor.] Erik comes over and gives her a scratch behind the ears as he blows out each lantern in the lobby. He pokes his head out and calls for her one last time, but she is gone, long gone, giddy, drunk on possibility as she runs through the street with only her rucksack on her back, making for the edge of town, making for whatever's out there. She undoes the lace of her apron and it drops to the floor. The force is so strong it damn near knocks you off your feet. With a loping grace, the dark wizard bobs and tumbles about in the air until it catches a current. His bed rigid and it glides towards the distant moonlight streaming in from the mouth of the Citadel. In mere seconds the stream that was rocketing him to the moon is gone. A heavy silence settles as the magic from the eggs seemed to turn the tide after years of abuse and fractures from his years of glutiny feeding from their energy. The Dark Wizards plummets and crashes on the jagged red trees below. [[Root around inside.]]You step up to the table. All eyes turn to you. You ask about Amati's finger. The whole room goes quiet. A barrel-chested man with stands and glares at you with his one good eye. <span id="barrel"><u>BARREL-CHESTED MAN</u> "You play with us and lose a finger, you leave that finger behind. You don't come crawling back begging for it. You want that finger... you put up a finger to match."</span> He thrusts a bloody stump of an index finger, wrapped in stained old gauze, at your chest. (ask something else)->Madame Pellax]] [["No. I've got to go." (end conversation)->His Majesty's]]<span id="titles">Prologues and Preambles</span> It's last call at Moonlit Prowl Tavern. A known haven for Gooseglers and thieves. The air is thick with the scent of spiced ale and the murmur of hushed conversations. A Danger Cat gets up on a barstool and calls for one more round of ale. In the corner, a game of darts goes very wrong. Someone, somewhere, sings loudly off-key. Someone somewhere else screams at him to shut the hell up. The last of the desperate lovers shrug and pair off: "*I suppose you'll have to do...*" As for you? You are (link:"utterly sober.")[(link:"okay, maybe slightly tipsy.")[(link:"drunk.")[(link-reveal:"*very* drunk.")[ The barroom cants back and forth around you. The stench of pipe weed fills up your nostrils. You (link-reveal:"stumble through the crowd...")[ and slam right into (link:"someone.")[(link:"some muscled goon.")[<u>a soldier.</u> He's clad in tarnished silver armor and the rust-red crest of the king.(set: $soldierreveal to 1)]] His beer goes spilling all over him. He glares at you, lip curling into a sneer. A hush falls over the bar. Everyone is watching. (link-reveal:"He steps towards you...")[ putting up his dukes. You're what he's been looking for all night: an excuse to get his knuckles bloody. (set: $fightoutcome to 1) You sigh relief and make your way back towards [[your table.]]In SMUGGLER'S PASS, you have three stats: TANK, MAGE, and ROGUE. Many of the places you go and people you meet will also fall into one of these three categories. Picking some options will **increase these stats**, building up your character through your choices. Some times, options will be **locked** (🔒) if you don't have a certain stat high enough. When you see a locked option, you can usually go do something else to increase that stat, then come back and choose it. (link:"Learn more about TANKS.")[**Tanks** get their knuckles bloody first and ask questions later. Pick options that are aggressive or violent to increase this stat and ruffle some feathers to unlock options of greater physical intimidation and derring-do.] (link:"Learn more about MAGES.")[**Mages** seek the spiritual and opt for peaceful solutions wherever possible. Pick diplomatic options and be kind to others to increase this stat and unlock options of greater perception, spiritual growth, and healing.] (link:"Learn more about Danger Cats.")[**Danger Cats** are sneaky and think differently. While tanks solve problems through brute force and mages solve them through diplomacy, Danger Cats will solve them with their quick wit. In addition to thievery and lock-picking, Danger Cats tend to be silver-tongued and adept at talking their enemies in circles. Pick options that are more mercenary or sneaky to unlock options to break into places, steal things, and deploy a sly tongue.] [[Return to instructions.->Instructions.]]Your current quests and subgoals will be shown in the sidebar. Completing a goal will get you more gold, which can be exchanged for stat boosts in the taverns or other story options throughout. Most side quests will have an option to accept or reject the quest when you're offered it. You can usually return to the character offering the quest and accept it later if you don't choose to accept it the first time. [[Return to instructions.->Instructions.]]You save in SMUGGLER'S PASS by clicking "Save game" in the sidebar on any passage. This will save your current passage and all the variables you've set, like your stats and open quests. Clicking "Load last save" on the sidebar will restore your game to the last save point. Not up for finishing SMUGGLER'S PASS in one session? No problem! You can come back later and keep playing from whever you've saved as long as you don't clear your browser history. [[Return to instructions.->Instructions.]]In SMUGGLER'S PASS, gold is a form of experience point you get for completing quests as well as a currency you spend and receive within the fiction. [[Return to instructions.->Instructions.]](if: $ending is 1)[<span id="titles">LAST CALL ON THE EDGE OF Gmemia...</span> Meeka steps out of Gmemia and into the forests beyond. She walks, untroubled, under the light of the moon. Basking in the twilight, she stops and listens to the sounds of the wind, a babbling brook somewhere not far off, insects chirping about something or other. She [[smiles->dark wizardending]], totally at peace.](else-if: $ending is 2)[<span id="titles">LAST CALL AT Moonlit Prowl...</span> You(if: $SMUGisalive is true)[, SMUG,] and Meeka sit at a table. Each year at the beginning of the Mahikka Ratti, the Nama Raka (chosen child) climbs the tower and blows the Karoti horn, waking Vela the dark wizard from her hibernation and summoning her from her cavern to the south. The village honours her with a week of good food and merriment for all... including Vela herself! The roost and the Mahikka Ratti are Gmemia's number one tourist attraction. Travellers journey from far and wide to see the moss dragon before she returns to her slumber. The coins they spend at our taverns and shops keep Gmemia going through our rough winters with the dark wizard, and make our independence from the high king possible."* [[Step away from the plaque.]](if: $SMUGisalive is true)[<span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "Well shit."</span> ]<span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "Barnes *lied* to us. flames.]]</span><span id="dialogue">+ 1 MAGE</span>(set: $mage to $mage + 1) <span id="pellax"><u>MADAME PELLAX</u> "I've seen much in my time, but not a single thing to convince me that when you slough off your body, where you'll end up is anything more than a role of the dice. The dance goes on. And besides, there are so few ways to earn an honest living in Stonkana, under the boot of the king. In immoral times, dishonesty becomes truth and vice becomes virtue. "</span> She spindles her fingers together, tapping her impossibly long purple fingernails with a *clack clack*. <span id="pellax"><u>MADAME PELLAX</u> "Now... I expect you have something to tell me about who the spy is?"</span> [["The serious-faced young woman."]] [["The posh, nervous fellow."]] [["The chubby dwarf."]] [["I'm not going to tell you."]]SMUGGLER'S PASS is a story that assumes you're a hard drinkin' adventurer in a low fantasy world, and it opens with your character already drunk. While drinking can later be avoided, this can hamper your ability to get some stat upgrades and complete some quests. If your player character drinking or becoming inebriated may be triggering or alienating for you, this is probably not the ideal game to play. Some other triggers are less central to the story and may be only be encountered depending on the choices you make. These are listed below. (link-reveal:"Loss of children.")[ DOGE, the dog in the Red Roof Inn, has lost her puppies, but the quest has a happy ending.] (link-reveal:"Animal death.")[ The story is premised around killing a dark wizard, but with the right options in the Citadel, this can be avoided. A number of fantasy creatures can be hunted in the alleys, but this can be entirely avoided as it's an optional element for grinding up more gold.] (link-reveal:"Death of main characters.")[ Your companion SMUG can die in the encounter with the Wizard. To avoid this, make sure to keep quiet when he's attempting to kill the Wizard. The story can end with you and your friends dying in a fire.] (link-reveal:"Emotional trauma due to war.")[ Your friend SMUG has war trauma due to his time in the trenches.] (link-reveal:"Fire.")[ The story can end with you and your companions dying in a fire.] [[Play.->storyinit]] [[Return to start menu.->SMUGGLER'S PASS]] <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "A good story is worth more than any gold."</span>(if: $SMUGisalive is true)[ <span id="SMUG"><u>SMUG</u> "Guess sometimes you gotta do what's right. Damn the money."</span>] The heat from the fire inside the Moonshot reaches you even here. You [[scramble up the steps...]]You wave a hand and the doorman's eyes become curiously vacant. <span id="doorman"><u>DOORMAN</u> "Ah, yes, that's it. That's the password. Come right this way."</span> He smiles and steps aside, beckoning you in. <span id="Meeka"><u>Meeka</u> "You know I don't approve of charming people... but if it gets us through this godsforsaken night, I'll make an exception..."</span> [[Step inside.->ConstructsPeaceful]](link: "Save game▼")[(replace: ?saveslotsworkarea)[(display: "Save Game Collapse Button and Dropdown")]](link: "Save Game▲")[(replace: ?saveslotsworkarea)[(display: "Save Game Button")]] (link:"Slot A")[(if:(save-game:"Slot A"))[ Game saved!](else: )[ Sorry, I couldn't save your game.]] (link:"Slot B")[(if:(save-game:"Slot B"))[ Game saved!](else: )[ Sorry, I couldn't save your game.]] (link:"Slot C")[(if:(save-game:"Slot C"))[ Game saved!](else: )[ Sorry, I couldn't save your game.]](link: "Load game▼")[(replace: ?loadslotsworkarea)[(display: "Load Game Collapse Button and Dropdown")]](link: "Load Game▲")[(replace: ?loadslotsworkarea)[(display: "Load Game Button")]] (link: "Load slot A")[(if: (saved-games:) contains "Slot A")[(load-game: "Slot A")](else:)[You don't have any games saved in that slot!]] (link: "Load slot B")[(if: (saved-games:) contains "Slot B")[(load-game: "Slot B")](else:)[You don't have any games saved in that slot!]] (link: "Load slot C")[(if: (saved-games:) contains "Slot C")[(load-game: "Slot C")](else:)[You don't have any games saved in that slot!]](link: "Restart game▼")[(replace: ?restartworkarea)[(display: "Restart Game Collapse Button and Dropdown")]](link: "Restart game▲")[(replace: ?restartworkarea)[(display: "Restart Game Button")]] You're sure?
